gpu: X.Org AMD Radeon (TM) RX 480 Graphics (POLARIS10 / DRM 3.26.0 / 4.18.7-200.fc28.x86_64, LLVM 6.0.0)

title: Call of Duty: World at War

notes: Runs great out the box. Performance is un-optimised; playing on lowest settings and highest settings make no discernible difference to FPS. Maintains 25+ FPS going right up to 60 FPS, all over the place. Doesn't ruin the experience for me.
title: Call of Duty: World at War

notes: Launches and loads zombies and can be played normally. Froze after attempting to change texture settings resolution can be changed without issues minor stutters present.
title: Call of Duty: World at War

gpu: X.Org AMD Radeon (TM) R9 Fury Series (FIJI, DRM 3.26.0, 4.18.9-arch1-1-ARCH, LLVM 6.0.1)
notes: The first mission in the campaign runs at 25-35 fps with lots of structures around, and has reached a maximum of 91 fps when in wooded areas or areas with little to render. All settings can be changed including resolution. Mouse seems to jump around or stutter, turning on mouse smoothing in the options menu of the game seems to help a lot. In zombies, same fps experiences except after a while of playing and opening doors to the rest of the map, the lag seems to balance out and I eventually got 60 fps stable in areas that were previously laggy. I have not tested multiplayer.
title: Call of Duty: World at War

notes: Audio is broken, crackles and stutters. Game seems to lag once playing. The audio and choppyness of the game makes it unplayable
title: Call of Duty: World at War

notes: Performs reasonably well with dips under 60 FPS often enough. Small stuttering, takes a while after starting a match for performance to increase.
